==Events==
* [[524]] &ndash; The [[Franks]] are defeated by the [[Burgundians]] in the [[Battle of Vézeronce]].
* [[841]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of Fontenoy (841)|Battle of Fontenay-en-Puisaye]], forces led by [[Charles the Bald]] and [[Louis the German]] defeat the armies of [[Lothair I]] of Italy and [[Pepin II of Aquitaine]].
*[[1530]] &ndash; At the [[Diet of Augsburg]] the [[Augsburg Confession]] is presented to the [[Holy Roman Emperor]] by the [[Lutheran]] princes and [[Prince-elector|Electors]] of [[Germany]].
*[[1658]] &ndash; [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] forces fail to retake [[Jamaica]] at the [[Battle of Rio Nuevo (1658)|Battle of Rio Nuevo]] during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1654–60)|Anglo-Spanish War]].
*[[1678]] &ndash; [[Republic of Venice|Venetian]] [[Elena Cornaro Piscopia]] is the first woman awarded a [[Doctor of Philosophy|doctorate of philosophy]] when she graduates from the [[University of Padua]].
*[[1741]] &ndash; [[Maria Theresa of Austria]] is crowned [[List of rulers of Hungary|Queen of Hungary]].
*[[1786]] &ndash; [[Gavriil Pribylov]] discovers [[St. George Island (Alaska)|St. George Island]] of the [[Pribilof Islands]] in the [[Bering Sea]].
*[[1788]] &ndash; [[Virginia]] becomes the 10th state to ratify the [[United States Constitution]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; [[Battle of the Little Bighorn]] and the death of Lieutenant Colonel [[George Armstrong Custer]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[Taoism|Taoist]] monk [[Wang Yuanlu]] discovers the [[Dunhuang manuscripts]], a cache of ancient texts that are of great historical and religious significance, in the [[Mogao Caves]] of [[Dunhuang]], China.
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Pittsburgh|Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] millionaire [[Harry Thaw]] shoots and kills prominent architect [[Stanford White]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Mann Act]], which prohibits interstate transport of females for “immoral purposes”; the ambiguous language would be used to selectively prosecute people for years to come.
*  1910   &ndash; [[Igor Stravinsky]]'s ballet ''[[The Firebird]]'' is premiered in Paris, bringing him to prominence as a composer.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]] veterans begin arriving at the [[Great Reunion of 1913]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; Capt. [[Lowell H. Smith]] and Lt. John P. Richter perform the first ever [[aerial refueling]] in a [[Airco DH-4|DH-4B]] [[biplane]]
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Diplomatic relations]] between the [[Soviet Union]] and [[Colombia]] are established.
*[[1938]] &ndash; Dr. [[Douglas Hyde]] is inaugurated as the first [[President of Ireland]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: France officially surrenders to Germany at 01:35.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: Jews in the [[Częstochowa Ghetto]] in [[Poland]] stage [[Częstochowa Ghetto Uprising|an uprising]] against the Nazis.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Tali-Ihantala]], the largest battle ever fought in the [[Nordic Countries]], begins.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: [[United States Navy]] and [[Royal Navy]] ships [[Bombardment of Cherbourg|bombard]] Cherbourg to support [[United States Army]] units engaged in the [[Battle of Cherbourg]].
*  1944   &ndash; The final page of the comic [[Krazy Kat]] was published, exactly two months after its author [[George Herriman]] died.
*[[1947]] &ndash; ''[[The Diary of a Young Girl]]'' (better known as ''The Diary of Anne Frank'') is published.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Berlin Blockade#The start of the Berlin Airlift|Berlin airlift]] begins.
*[[1949]] &ndash; ''[[Long-Haired Hare]]'', starring [[Bugs Bunny]], is released in theaters.
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[Korean War]] begins with the invasion of [[South Korea]] by [[North Korea]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; Two [[cryptography|cryptographers]] working for the United States [[National Security Agency]] left for vacation to Mexico, and from there [[Martin and Mitchell Defection|defected to the Soviet Union]]. 
*[[1967]] &ndash; Broadcasting of the first live global satellite television program: ''[[Our World (International TV special)|Our World]]''
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Mozambique]] achieves independence.
*  1975   &ndash; Prime Minister [[Indira Gandhi]] has a state of [[The Emergency (India)|internal Emergency]] declared in India.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Missouri]] Governor [[Kit Bond]] issues an executive order rescinding the [[Extermination Order (Mormonism)|Extermination Order]], formally apologizing on behalf of the state of Missouri for the suffering it had caused to the members of [[Latter Day Saint movement|The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[rainbow flag (LGBT movement)|rainbow flag]] representing [[gay pride]] is flown for the first time in the San Francisco [[San Francisco Pride|Gay Freedom Day Parade]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Microsoft]] is restructured to become an incorporated business in its home state of [[Washington (state)|Washington]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Greece]] abolishes the [[head shaving]] of recruits in the [[military]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Croatia]] and [[Slovenia]] declare their independence from [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Kim Campbell]] is sworn in as the first female [[List of Prime Ministers of Canada|Prime Minister of Canada]].
*  1993   &ndash; [[Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action]] is adopted by [[World Conference on Human Rights]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; An unmanned [[Progress spacecraft]] collides with the [[Russia]]n [[space station]] [[Mir]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; In ''[[Clinton v. City of New York]]'', the [[United States Supreme Court]] decides that the [[Line Item Veto Act of 1996]] is [[United States Constitution|unconstitutional]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani]] becomes the 8th [[List of emirs of Qatar|Emir of Qatar]].
